bibl.title: Telegram from [s.n.] Harris to the Depot Quartermaster, October 26, [1918]

div1.p: Moran is ordered to report to Hoboken, New Jersey equipped for extended field service.

div1.head: Telegram from [s.n.] Harris to the Depot Quartermaster, October 26, [1918]
div1.opener:
3
SIGNAL CORPS, U.S.A.
TELEGRAM
3 NY MQ 64 GOVT --STC65WDS--
WA-WASHINGTON DC OCT 26 1210AM 1918
DEPOT QUARTERMASTER
NEWYORK NY
div1.p:
CAPTAINS JOHN J MORAN CHARLES F MELL JOSEPH A BOGAN AND ISADORE MANHIEM
AND FIRST LIEUTS CHARLES ARTHUR CONE CHESTER R FOUTS IVAN A ALLEN AND
JOSEPH EDWARD STONE QUARTERMASTER CORPS IS RELIEVED PRESENT DUTIES
DIRECT THEM PROCEED HOBOKEN NEW JERSEY AND REPORT COMMANDING GENERAL
EQUIPPED FOR EXTENDED FIELD SERVICE TRAVEL NECESSARY IN MILITARY SERVICE
DIRECT THEM HAVE PROPHYLACTIC TREATMENT ADMINISTERED
div1.closer:
HARRIS 753AM
4037
Capt. John J. Moran
Stores & Warehousing Div.
Gov. Island
RECORDED
OUT
O.D.Q.M.N.Y.
OCT 26 1918
